alert.note: Alert for Avoyelles; Evangeline; Rapides; St. Landry (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 08 at 7:31PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN RAPIDES... EVANGELINE...AVOYELLES AND ST. LANDRY PARISHES THROUGH 800 PM CST... At 731 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Effie to near Bayou Chicot to near Reddell to near Mamou. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to vegetation and outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Opelousas, Eunice, Ville Platte, Marksville, Bunkie, Mamou, Simmesport, Basile, Moreauville, Cheneyville, Turkey Creek, Palmetto, Bordelonville, Morrow, Effie, Sunset, Cottonport, Pine Prairie, Mansura, and Washington. This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 9 and 61. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CST for central, south central and southwestern Louisiana.
